name: Mercure Versailles Chateau

reviews.text: We arrived two hours before official check-in and our rooms were ready which was nice. I had specifically booked this hotel because of its secure underground car parking. We were staying here for 2 nights after a two-week holiday in the south of france. Whilst we took an overnight bag into the hotel all of our other luggage (quite a lot really) had to be left in the car and I did not want to park on the street with all of our suitcase visible in the back. I understood that car park spaces had to be pre-booked and I did this when booking our two rooms - this was several months ago. Upon arrival I was told that the car park was full - that it was first come first served and that anyway, our vehicle (a people carrier) wouldn't fit in there anyway. I was quite put out but the receptionist told us to find a space on the street. She didn't explain that the "payant" spaces are free in August so we were confused as it appeared that you could only park for a maximum of 2 hours.
reviews.title: Very mixed feelings about this hotel - would not stop there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms were off a courtyard on the ground floor and the courtyard itself was very old fashioned and depressing. 1970s cement and stone paving blocks. It looked more like a prison than a hotel. The rooms were fine - nothing special but clean and tidy. As other reviewers say, the rooms were exceptionally small with nowhere to even put our overnight bag. Also, because it was off a small yard, it was very dark inside the room - rather gloomy I would say. A complimentary small bottle of water was greatly appreciated. Unlike other reviewers, our air con/heating did seem to work.
reviews.title: Versailles weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our first morning I raced ahead to Versailles (the hotel is really well positioned for this) to buy tickets. My husband stayed behind with my 82 year old mother and booked a taxi from reception. She seemed puzzled that he would want a taxi but he pointed out that even a 15 minute walk is too much for my mother before she even starts to walk around the palce. She appeared to phone for a taxi and my husband and mother stood in reception and waited for 20 minutes. When they eventually questioned why no taxi had turned up she told them that there was only 1 taxi company in the whole of Versailles (gasp in unbelieving astonishment) and that they did not work on a Sunday. They had spent 20 minutes stood close to her and she hadn't bothered to tell them that she hadn't actually booked them a taxi at all. My husband is a very laid back person but he was furious. Of course there are numerous taxi companies in Versailles and they were working as not only did we see taxis throughout the day, when we got back somebody was being dropped off in front of the hotel in a taxi. Truly appalling service (and lies).
reviews.title: mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a long weekend at Versailles and found this hotel both practical and pleasant. The price was reasonable for a 3 star hotel andwas very well renovated. The standard of the room was high, modern and extremely clean, although small. Breakfast was varied and the staff on duty both at reception and the breakfast room were friendly and efficient. A good base for visiting Versailles and not far from the RER train to Paris centre. Would stay here again !
reviews.title: Location can't be beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good for one night only, just to see the castle... but thats about it. the staff was friendly, however the rooms were tiny as the garage. don't get the rooms in the highest floor, the seem to be smaller and lower then the others. breakfast is nothing special, but had some ok pastries and cheeses, the coffee was aweful. sorry.
reviews.title: Poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is nicely situated at about 500 m from the Versailles Chateau, which makes it a good alternative for a short stay if you do not want to pay rates above 200 euro.Small Mercure, modern but small rooms.No mini bar in the room and very small parking which was not accessible to our car, however, parking is easy to find after 1900 hrs and is free as from saturday evening.Nice breakfast, although not full english bkfst
reviews.title: Nothing more, nothing less

reviews.text: We chose Mercure Versailles Chateau as we wanted to have some peace and quiet, but well connected using the RER to visit Paris and also to connect with trains to Giverny, Fontainebleau bringing our bikes. The hotel is recently refurbish with comfortable furniture's and colours giving it a homey feel. The rooms are decent size, very cosy, well maintained and clean. The beds, even thought not large size, are very comfortable and bed linen are of good quality. The breakfast area was immaculate and breakfasts were excellent; fresh fruit, juices, sausages, bacon, eggs, cold choices, bread, pastries and yoghurts. The staff was friendly, professional and attentive, willing to give recommendations for restaurants, trains etc. Parking is an issue as the Hotel garage is very tight. It was not possible for us to park our Touran there. We had to park in a Vinci Parking some blocks away. To our distress we found that the Vinci parking doesn't take foreign credit cards. When calling the service phone number at the parking there was a women answering only speaking French and apparently located in Marseilles informing that we could only pay with coins (an amount above 60 Euro). We are very pleased with our stay at Mercure Versailles and would certainly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A great Hotel if you want to have some peace and quiet, but well connected to Paris and surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located close to the Chateau- about 1/2 mile away. Easy to walk to the market and restaurants. The room was clean and quiet, no refrigerator but there is AC which was quiet and worked well. Basic, but comfortable, hotel experience similar standard to a Premier Inn in the UK, Not many English channels on the TV, we get a bit fed up with BBC World. Their car park is very small (only about 12 spaces) so you need to reserve a space in advance. Cost 12 euro per day. The reception staff were polite, all spoke english, and were very helpful with car park, restaurant recommendation and resetting the door key card which kept locking us out annoyingly.
reviews.title: Good hotel, close to Palace, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked B&B, they have no restaurant so you have to go out for dinner, but there are several within 5 minutes walk that are good, and more in the town square which is only 10 mins walk. We tried Chez Renaud, French cuisine, which was nice ambiance but pricey, average food, and Armenia, Italian cuisine, decor a bit tired but good food. (These were both in the same street as the hotel).
reviews.title: Good location - average hotel

reviews.text: We paid 14 euros each for the hotel breakfast which is a bit pricey for a basic continental, but it was all good and saved us hunting around first thing in the morning.
reviews.title: Wouldn't go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town of Versailles is very nice, especially if you prefer a more quiet atmosphere than in Paris, The Palace is, of course, stunning. Definitely a recommended location and experience.
reviews.title: its a 3 star hotel , and it probably came in at 2.5 , passable for one night stay.

reviews.text: The location is close to the Chateau- about 1/2 mile away. Easy to walk to the market and restaurants. The room was clean, no refrigerator but there is AC. Basic hotel experience but the town of Versailles is very nice, especially if you prefer a more quiet atmosphere than in Paris,
reviews.title: Good location for tourists but mixed service, not a business hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in July - It is located centrally in versilles and easy walk to all the main stations. Just down the road (100m) plenty of resturants (italian, chinese, indian, french and japanese) and suggest you visit O'Paris irish bar which is down next to the palace, ideal location and reasonable (for France) price for beer.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was nice continental with a large variety (also included eggs, sausage, bacon and pancakes).
reviews.title: Helpful reception staff, good location but tiny rooms.

reviews.text: Room was OK, but agree that the air-con is sub-standard and found it quite warm during the night.
reviews.title: Helpful staff, nice room
Nice location. Excellent staff. Rooms are clean but tiny and hot.

description: The Mercure Versailles Chateau is located in the heart of Versailles, within easy reach of the three stations that connect to Paris and the airports, and close to the business district, museums and monuments. Offering 60 airconditioned rooms, including 8family rooms (please contact the hotel directly to book one of these) and 3 rooms for guests with limited mobility, the hotel also features a meeting room and an undercover pay car park, subject to availability. Public swimming pool nearby.
